intro: Minthostachys glabrescens, commonly known as the glabrous mintweed, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and open woodlands. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
